Package com.redis.foundation.std

Class DatUtl

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.std.DatUtl
public class DatUtl extends Object
The DatUtl class provides static convenience methods for calculating date/time conversions.

The Apache Commons has a number of good utility methods for date/time calculations. http://commons.apache.org/lang/api-2.5/org/apache/commons/lang/time/DateUtils.html

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0 Nov 27, 2019
Author:
Al Cole

  • Method Details

    • toJulian

      public static double toJulian(int[] aYmd)
      Returns the Julian day number that begins at noon of this day. Positive year signifies A.D., negative year B.C. Remember that the year after 1 B.C. was 1 A.D. System.out.println("Julian date for May 23, 1968 : " + toJulian(new int[]{1968, 5, 23}));

      Reference: Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed., Cambridge University Press 1992

      Parameters:
      aYmd - Three value integer array (Year, Month, Day).
      Returns:
      The calculated Julian Day value.

    • toJulian

      public static double toJulian(Date aDate)
      Returns the Julian day number that begins at noon of this day. Positive year signifies A.D., negative year B.C. Remember that the year after 1 B.C. was 1 A.D. System.out.println("Julian date for May 23, 1968 : " + toJulian(new Date()));

      Reference: Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed., Cambridge University Press 1992

      Parameters:
      aDate - The date to convert.
      Returns:
      The calculated Julian Day value.

    • fromJulian

      public static int[] fromJulian(double aJulianDay)
      Converts a Julian day to a calendar date.

      Reference: Numerical Recipes in C, 2nd ed., Cambridge University Press 1992

      Parameters:
      aJulianDay - a Julian Day value.
      Returns:
      A three value integer array {Y, M, D}

    • detectCreateDate

      public static Date detectCreateDate(String aDateTimeValue)
      Attempts to detect the date/time format of the value and create a 'Date' object.
      Parameters:
      aDateTimeValue - String value.
      Returns:
      Date object if the format is recognized or null.

    • calculateBusinessDays

      public static long calculateBusinessDays(LocalDate aStartDate, LocalDate anEndDate)
      Calculates the number of business days (excluding weekends) between two dates (inclusive).

      https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4600034/calculate-number-of-weekdays-between-two-dates-in-java

      Parameters:
      aStartDate - Start date.
      anEndDate - End date.
      Returns:
      Number of business days.

    • calculateBusinessDays

      public static long calculateBusinessDays(LocalDate aStartDate, LocalDate anEndDate, List<LocalDate> aHolidayList)
      Calculates the number of business days (excluding weekends) between two dates (inclusive). In addition, this utility method will factor in holidays (e.g. skip them in the count) for the calculation.

      https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4600034/calculate-number-of-weekdays-between-two-dates-in-java

      Parameters:
      aStartDate - Start date.
      anEndDate - End date.
      aHolidayList - List of holidays to skip.
      Returns:
      Number of business days.
